Page headers

Page headers

Every page on business.gov.au has a page header designed to help the user quickly understand what the page is about.

  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts
  • Examples and assets

Guidelines for use

Purpose: 

A page header helps users understand what the content of the page is about and its relevance to them. It includes the primary H1 (page title), a label and a supporting page description.  

Headers for grant landing pages 

These differ from all other headers. They use a plain English title as the H1, and the grant name is displayed in the label field – this is also the page title in this case. 

When to use this component: 

  • Page headers are built into every page pattern and the component doesn’t need to be added manually. They vary in height and colour depending on page hierarchy in the IA.  

Content rules: 

  • H1: Recommended 90 character limit 
  • Description: Recommended 250 character limit  
  • Options for label display: 
  • Parent page title (e.g. on some index pages and on grant recipient pages). 
    • Content type (e.g. 101) 
    • Label override (e.g. on some business topic index pages) 
    • No label (e.g. on tertiary business topic pages)

Layouts

Page layouts

Header components are used on full width and 2/3 width pages.

Component layout options

Full width layout

Desktop, Tablet & Mobile: One component per page. The page header background colour is wider than the body content and extends the full width of the screen.
